name: Ouphe Vandals
text: {G}, Sacrifice Ouphe Vandals: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source and destroy that artifact if it's on the battlefield. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

editions.flavor: The ouphes finally managed to still the clockwork monstrosity by catching themselves in its cogs.

name: Our Market Research Shows That Players Like Really Long Card Names So We Made this Card to Have the Absolute Longest Card Name Ever Elemental
text: Art rampage 2 (Whenever this becomes blocked by a creature, it gets +2/+2 for each creature in the blocker's art beyond the first.)

editions.flavor: Just call it OMRSTPLRLCNSWMTCTHTALCNEE for short.

name: Oust
text: Put target creature into its owner's library second from the top. Its controller gains 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"‘Invincible' is just a word."
—Gideon Jura

"‘Invincible' is just a word."
—Gideon Jura

name: Outbreak
text:
You may discard a Swamp card rather than pay Outbreak's mana cost.
Choose a creature type. All creatures of that type get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: This plague chooses its victims.

name: Outland Boar
text: Outland Boar can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.

editions.flavor: The vibrant forest of Peema is awash with aether. Its animals are stronger, faster, and more aggressive than their counterparts elsewhere.

name: Outland Colossus
text:
Renown 6 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put six +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)
Outland Colossus can't be blocked by more than one creature.

name: Outmaneuver
text: X target blocked creatures assign their combat damage this turn as though they weren't blocked.

editions.flavor:
"Push one goblin into sight, an' run a lot. That's tactics."
—Jula, goblin raider

name: Outnumber
text: Outnumber deals damage to target creature equal to the number of creatures you control.

editions.flavor: Everyone who could still lift a weapon had a part in retaking Sea Gate.

name: Outpost Siege
text:
As Outpost Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.
• Dragons — Whenever a creature you control leaves the battlefield, Outpost Siege deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

name: Outrage Shaman
text: Chroma — When Outrage Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature equal to the number of red mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.

editions.flavor: A boggart's mind is a tinderbox of volatile thoughts, hungry for a spark.

name: Outrider en-Kor
text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Outrider en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.

name: Outrider of Jhess
text: Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: The island nation of Jhess is under constant siege from Valeron on the mainland. Riders traverse the coastline, always on the lookout for sails or aven.

name: Outwit
text: Counter target spell that targets a player.

editions.flavor: The student asks how a spell is begun. The master ponders what ends it.

name: Ovalchase Daredevil
text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may return Ovalchase Daredevil from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: "Let me guess. You thought I was dead."

name: Ovalchase Dragster
text:
Trample, haste
Crew 1 (Tap any number of creatures you control with total power 1 or more: This Vehicle becomes an artifact creature until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: It'll either crash or win the race. Possibly both.

name: Overabundance
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced, and Overabundance deals 1 damage to him or her.

name: Overbeing of Myth
text:
Overbeing of Myth's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.

editions.flavor:
"She walks among us unseen, learning from our imperfections."
—The Seer's Parables

"She walks among us unseen, learning from our imperfections."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Overblaze
text:
Each time target permanent would deal damage to a creature or player this turn, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
Splice onto Arcane {2}{R}{R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

name: Overburden
text: Whenever a player puts a nontoken creature onto the battlefield, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The Kipamu League knew what Keld refused to acknowledge: the land could support no more.

name: Overeager Apprentice
text: Discard a card, Sacrifice Overeager Apprentice: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: Slow and steady may not always win the race, but at least it doesn't end up splattered on the walls.
Slow and steady may not always win the race, but at least it doesn't end up splattered on the walls.
Slow and steady may not always win the race, but at least it doesn't end up splattered on the walls.

name: Overgrown Battlement
text:
Defender
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each creature with defender you control.

editions.flavor:
"Our enemy is nothing less than the end of all life. We shall not want for allies."
—The War Diaries

name: Overgrown Estate
text: Sacrifice a land: You gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: The decay of Crovax's ancestral home matched the state of his soul.

name: Overgrown Tomb
text:
({T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.)
As Overgrown Tomb enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Overgrown Tomb enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: The best funeral shroud is the fabric of new life.

name: Overgrowth
text:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G}{G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

editions.flavor: Life needs no encouragement.

"Let the forest spread! From salt, stone, and fen, let the new trees rise."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Overlaid Terrain
text:
As Overlaid Terrain enters the battlefield, sacrifice all lands you control.
Lands you control have "{T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool."

editions.flavor: One must reap before one can sow.

name: Overload
text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is 2 or less. If Overload was kicked, destroy that artifact if its converted mana cost is 5 or less instead.

name: Overmaster
text:
The next instant or sorcery spell you cast this turn can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Trickery can't defeat raw power."
—Matoc, lavamancer

name: Override
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each artifact you control.

editions.flavor: "The Knowledge Pool has all the answers—especially ‘No.'"

name: Overrule
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. You gain X life.

editions.flavor: With one commanding word, the spell was put down and a fine collected for its casting.
With one commanding word, the spell was put down and a fine collected for its casting.

name: Overrun
text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: Nature doesn't walk.

"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
Nature doesn't walk.
Nature doesn't walk.

"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
Nature doesn't walk.

—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

Nature doesn't walk.

The dance of angry feet
—Nantuko expression meaning
"stampede"

name: Overseer of the Damned
text:
Flying
When Overseer of the Damned enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature.
Whenever a nontoken creature an opponent controls dies, create a tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

name: Oversold Cemetery
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have four or more creature cards in your graveyard, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

name: Oversoul of Dusk
text: Protection from blue, from black, and from red

editions.flavor:
"Some say she hid the sun herself, a desperate act to save it from its ultimate extinction."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Overtaker
text: {3}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Untap target creature and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "It's no challenge to master a Mercadian."

name: Overwhelm
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Let the song of Selesnya be heard above the rhythm of our thundering hordes!"
The Conclave acts with a single will, expressed by countless warriors.
"Let the song of Selesnya be heard above the rhythm of our thundering hordes!"

name: Overwhelming Denial
text:
Surge {U}{U} (You may cast this spell for its surge cost if you or a teammate has cast another spell this turn.)
Overwhelming Denial can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Counter target spell.

name: Overwhelming Forces
text: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.

editions.flavor: By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.
By the year 208, Cao Cao commanded more than 1,000 experienced generals and a million infantry, cavalry, and naval troops.

name: Overwhelming Instinct
text: Whenever you attack with three or more creatures, draw a card.

editions.flavor: The biggest difference between a victory and a massacre is which side you're on.

name: Overwhelming Intellect
text: Counter target creature spell. Draw cards equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: "My brain hurts."
"My brain hurts."

name: Overwhelming Stampede
text: Until end of turn, creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X, where X is the greatest power among creatures you control.

editions.flavor:
"I trust the instincts of any beast over the advice of any human who presumes to be an expert in the art of war."
—Rinshel, elf insurgent

name: Ovinize
text: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and has base power and toughness 0/1.

editions.flavor:
"You wish for me to cow your enemies? I can do better than that . . . ."
—Teferi, second-level student

name: Ovinomancer
text:
When Ovinomancer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand.
{T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller creates a 0/1 green Sheep creature token.

name: Oviya Pashiri, Sage Lifecrafter
text:
{2}{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.
{4}{G}, {T}: Create an X/X colorless Construct artifact creature token, where X is the number of creatures you control.

editions.flavor: "Inspiration is reciprocal: we all have a responsibility to each other to create."

name: Ow
text: Whenever any creature damages a player, for each Ow card in play, that player says "Ow" once or Ow deals 1 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: Have you ever noticed how some flavor text has no relevance whatsoever to the card it's on?

name: Owl Familiar
text:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

name: Oxidda Daredevil
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Oxidda Daredevil gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: His goggles spattered with grime and his mouth full of bugs, he tossed the engines another priceless relic.

name: Oxidda Golem
text:
Affinity for Mountains (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Mountain you control.)
Haste

editions.flavor: The longer it patrols the smoldering crags of the Oxidda Chain, the more it adopts their fiery temper.
The longer it patrols the smoldering crags of the Oxidda Chain, the more it adopts their fiery temper.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Jace vs. Chandra
editions.flavor: The longer it patrols the smoldering crags of the Oxidda Chain, the more it adopts their fiery temper.

name: Oxidda Scrapmelter
text: When Oxidda Scrapmelter enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: It subsists on a diet rich in screaming metal and molten blood.

name: Oxidize
text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"Ashes to ashes, rust to rust."
—Viridian shaman

name: Oyobi, Who Split the Heavens
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, create a 3/3 white Spirit creature token with flying.

editions.flavor: Her angry call split the sky. From that rift descended her champions.

name: Pacification Array
text: {2}, {T}: Tap target artifact or creature.

editions.flavor: The Consulate had access to thousands of innovative devices displayed at the Inventors' Fair. A few small changes transformed some of them from marvels of ingenuity to instruments of oppression.

name: Pacifism
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

editions.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

"Fight? I cannot. I do not care if I live or die, so long as I can rest."
—Urza, to Serra

name: Pack Guardian
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Pack Guardian enters the battlefield, you may discard a land card. If you do, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.

name: Pack Hunt
text: Search your library for up to three cards with the same name as target creature, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: The one you see is just a diversion.

name: Pack Rat
text:
Pack Rat's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Rats you control.
{2}{B}, Discard a card: Create a token that's a copy of Pack Rat.

name: Pack's Disdain
text: Choose a creature type. Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn for each permanent of the chosen type you control.

editions.flavor: Like the sun to a flower, the adoring gaze of the tribe is sustenance to an elf. To be shunned is to wither.

name: Pact of Negation
text:
Counter target spell.
At the beginning of your next upkeep, pay {3}{U}{U}. If you don't, you lose the game.

editions.flavor: Those who expect betrayal at every turn are seldom disappointed.
Those who expect betrayal at every turn are seldom disappointed.

name: Pact of the Titan
text:
Create a 4/4 red Giant creature token.
At the beginning of your next upkeep, pay {4}{R}. If you don't, you lose the game.

name: Padeem, Consul of Innovation
text:
Artifacts you control have hexproof.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control the artifact with the highest converted mana cost or tied for the highest converted mana cost, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "Impress me."

name: Pain
text: Target player discards a card.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

name: Painbringer
text: {T}, Exile any number of cards from your graveyard: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards exiled this way.

name: Painful Lesson
text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

editions.flavor:
"You wish to remember this lesson? I will write it down for you."
—Senifet, vizier of Bontu

name: Painful Memories
text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.

editions.flavor:
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."
—Jolrael

"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."
—Jolrael

name: Painful Quandary
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player loses 5 life unless he or she discards a card.

editions.flavor:
"For each word spoken, one forgotten. For each thought, a memory rotten."
—Moriok incantation

name: Painful Truths
text: Converge — You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of colors of mana spent to cast Painful Truths.

editions.flavor: As the Eldrazi spread, no secret that could give Zendikar's defenders an advantage was considered too dangerous to seek.
As the Eldrazi spread, no secret that could give Zendikar's defenders an advantage was considered too dangerous to seek.

name: Pain Kami
text: {X}{R}, Sacrifice Pain Kami: Pain Kami deals X damage to target creature.

editions.flavor:
"All kami are our enemies now,
A very tough lesson to learn.
But it's one that's taken quickly,
When you feel what it's like to burn"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet

name: Pain Magnification
text: Whenever an opponent is dealt 3 or more damage by a single source, that player discards a card.

editions.flavor: The Rakdos make sure their victims remember their pain—or at least give up a little bit of their sanity in order to forget.

name: Pain Seer
text: Inspired — Whenever Pain Seer becomes untapped, reveal the top card of your library and put that card into your hand. You lose life equal to that card's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: Every twitching nerve and pulsing vein carries a message, discernible with the right tools.

name: Painsmith
text: Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may have target creature get +2/+0 and gain deathtouch until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Moriok see the artificer as a taskmaster, forcing lazy metal into more potent shapes.

name: Pain's Reward
text: Each player may bid life. You start the bidding with a bid of any number. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and draws four cards.

name: Painted Bluffs
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Centuries of scouring sands have carved and polished the rocky terrain of the Shefet Desert.

name: Painter's Servant
text:
As Painter's Servant enters the battlefield, choose a color.
All cards that aren't on the battlefield, spells, and permanents are the chosen color in addition to their other colors.

editions.flavor: It gathers hues from the twilight mist so that its master can paint a better world.
This whimsical automaton helps create beautiful murals, then stands guard as they dry.

name: Painwracker Oni
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature if you don't control an Ogre.

editions.flavor:
"Blood flows. Blood calls. Blood devours all and only blood remains."
—Ogre chant

name: Palace Familiar
text:
Flying
When Palace Familiar dies, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"The most profound secrets lie in the darkest places of the world. It can be prudent to make use of another set of eyes."
—Sidisi, Silumgar vizier

name: Palace Guard
text: Palace Guard can block any number of creatures.

editions.flavor: "I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."
"I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."

name: Palace Jailer
text:
When Palace Jailer enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
When Palace Jailer enters the battlefield, exile target creature an opponent controls until an opponent becomes the monarch. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

name: Palace Sentinels
text: When Palace Sentinels enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.

editions.flavor:
"One who ruled willing subjects would need no such protection."
—Adriana, Captain of the Guard

name: Palace Siege
text:
As Palace Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Dragons — At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

name: Paladin en-Vec
text: First strike, protection from black and from red (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike. It can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black or red.)

editions.flavor: "Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."
"Our belief shall be the lance that pierces Volrath's heart."
"I do not consider myself a hero. I know only what the Vec teach: justice must always be served and corruption must always be opposed."

name: Paladin of Prahv
text:
Whenever Paladin of Prahv deals damage, you gain that much life.
Forecast — {1}{W}, Reveal Paladin of Prahv from your hand: Whenever target creature deals damage this turn, you gain that much life. (Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.)

name: Pale Bears
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor:
"Daughter, on the day you have killed your Pale Bear, then will I give you your true name."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

name: Pale Moon
text: Until end of turn, if a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.

editions.flavor: Denizens of Rath had never seen the moon before. It was a symbol of change, not constancy.

name: Paleoloth
text: Whenever another creature with power 5 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"Gods do not sleep soundly in the earth's embrace."
—Mayael the Anima

name: Pale Recluse
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Forestcycling {2}, plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

name: Pale Rider of Trostad
text:
Skulk (This creature can't be blocked by creatures with greater power.)
When Pale Rider of Trostad enters the battlefield, discard a card.

editions.flavor:
"What's worse than being alone on the moors at night? Try not being alone."
—Nadila Maas, moor chaplain

name: Pale Wayfarer
text: {2}{W}{W}, {Q}: Target creature gains protection from the color of its controller's choice until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

editions.flavor: As it wandered Shadowmoor, it did not remember its crime—only its shame.

name: Paliano, the High City
text:
Reveal Paliano, the High City as you draft it. The player to your right chooses a color, you choose another color, then the player to your left chooses a third color.
{T}: Add one mana to your mana pool of any color chosen as you drafted cards named Paliano, the High City.

name: Paliano Vanguard
text:
Draft Paliano Vanguard face up.
As you draft a creature card, you may reveal it, note its creature types, then turn Paliano Vanguard face down.
Other creatures you control of a type you noted for cards named Paliano Vanguard get +1/+1.

name: Palinchron
text:
Flying
When Palinchron enters the battlefield, untap up to seven lands.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Palinchron to its owner's hand.

name: Palisade Giant
text: All damage that would be dealt to you or another permanent you control is dealt to Palisade Giant instead.

editions.flavor: Refusing guild allegiances, she fights for those who can't protect themselves.

name: Palladia-Mors
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Palladia-Mors unless you pay {R}{G}{W}.

name: Palladium Myr
text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The myr are like the Glimmervoid: blank canvases on which to build grand creations.
The myr are like the Glimmervoid: blank canvases on which to build grand creations.

name: Palliation Accord
text:
Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a shield counter on Palliation Accord.
Remove a shield counter from Palliation Accord: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

name: Pallid Mycoderm
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Pallid Mycoderm.
Remove three spore counters from Pallid Mycoderm: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Each creature you control that's a Fungus or a Saproling gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Pallimud
text:
As Pallimud enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Pallimud's power is equal to the number of tapped lands the chosen player controls.

editions.flavor: The old Vec tell tales of a beast that fed on scraps but turned its nose up at the lavish banquet they set in its honor.

name: Panacea
text: {X}{X}, {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: A drop numbs the tongue. A sip sends the heart racing. A draught reforges the body.

name: Pandemonium
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player of his or her choice.

editions.flavor:
"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

"If we cannot live proudly, we die so!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

name: Panglacial Wurm
text:
Trample
While you're searching your library, you may cast Panglacial Wurm from your library.

editions.flavor:
"Step lightly and we might be able to use it as a bridge."
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

name: Pangosaur
text: Whenever a player plays a land, return Pangosaur to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Only Rushwood is vast enough to swallow this creature whole.

name: Pang Tong, "Young Phoenix"
text: {T}: Target creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor:
". . . It was Pang Tong's boat-connecting scheme
That let Zhou Yu accomplish his great deed."
